channel.title: Super Mario Bros 3D
channel.description:
The demise of Zetabot gives me more time to focus on my legit project! Here's a simple pre-alpha tech demo in-game vid: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e734DZ7pI_E
This is my first project using opengl and 3d ever, and i find LWJGL extremely easy to use. This is way more entertaining working on than some runescape bot.

item.title: Super Mario Bros 3D
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:82, topic:337117”]source or its shopped![/quote][code]package com.smb3d.states.impl;

import com.smb3d.core.ResourceManager;
import com.smb3d.core.StateEngine;
import com.smb3d.core.TrueTypeFont;
import com.smb3d.core.gfx.Spritesheet;
import com.smb3d.core.loader.TextureLoader;
import com.smb3d.input.impl.MenuInput;
import com.smb3d.states.GameState;
import com.smb3d.ui.UIOverlay;
import com.smb3d.ui.util.Bounds;
import com.smb3d.ui.widgets.impl.UIButton;
import com.smb3d.ui.widgets.impl.UIButtonGroup;
import com.smb3d.ui.widgets.impl.UIScrollPane;
import com.smb3d.ui.widgets.impl.list.UIList;
import org.lwjgl.Sys;
import org.lwjgl.opengl.Display;
import org.lwjgl.opengl.GL11;
import org.lwjgl.util.glu.GLU;

import java.awt.*;

/**

  • User: Johan

  • Date: 2010-aug-24

  • Time: 13:37:29
    */
    public class MenuState implements GameState {

    private MenuInput input;

    private UIOverlay ui;

    private StateEngine engine;

    private TrueTypeFont font;

    public MenuState() {

    }

    public void create(StateEngine se) {

    }

    public StateEngine getEngine() {
    return engine;
    }

    public void load(StateEngine se) {
    this.engine = se;
    initGL();

     Font f = Font.createFont(Font.TRUETYPE_FONT, UIButton.class.getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("fonts/nes.ttf"));
 this.font = new TrueTypeFont(f.deriveFont(Font.PLAIN, 16), true);

 ResourceManager.getInstance().add("button_active", new TextureLoader().getTextures("menu/button.png", 128, 32)[1][0]);
 ResourceManager.getInstance().add("button_inactive", new TextureLoader().getTextures("menu/button.png", 128, 32)[0][0]);
 ResourceManager.getInstance().add("button_disabled", new TextureLoader().getTextures("menu/button.png", 128, 32)[2][0]);
 ResourceManager.getInstance().add("scrollpane_button", new TextureLoader().getTexture("menu/scrollpane_button.png"));
 ResourceManager.getInstance().add("font", font);

 input = new MenuInput(this);

 ui = new UIOverlay();
 UIButtonGroup buttonGroup = new UIButtonGroup("menu_group");
 buttonGroup.add(new UIButton("button_play", "Play", 270.0f, 450.0f));
 buttonGroup.add(new UIButton("button_levelselect", "Select Level", 270.0f, 350.0f));
 buttonGroup.add(new UIButton("button_leveleditor", "Level Editor", 270.0f, 250.0f));
 buttonGroup.add(new UIButton("button_quit", "Quit", 270.0f, 150.0f));
 ui.add(buttonGroup);
 ui.add(new UIScrollPane("scrollpane", new UIList("list", new Bounds(25.0f, 270.0f, 200.0f, 300.0f))));

    }

    public void unload(StateEngine se) {
    ResourceManager.getInstance().unloadAll();
    }

    private void initGL() {
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_COLOR_MATERIAL);
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_TEXTURE_2D);
    GL11.glDisable(GL11.GL_DITHER);
    GL11.glDepthFunc(GL11.GL_LESS);
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_NORMALIZE);
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_CULL_FACE);
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_BLEND);
    GL11.glBlendFunc(GL11.GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL11.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA);
    GL11.glEnable(GL11.GL_ALPHA_TEST);
    GL11.glAlphaFunc(GL11.GL_GREATER, 0.1f);
    GL11.glHint(GL11.GL_PERSPECTIVE_CORRECTION_HINT, GL11.GL_NICEST);
    GL11.glHint(GL11.GL_POLYGON_SMOOTH_HINT, GL11.GL_NICEST);
    GL11.glShadeModel(GL11.GL_SMOOTH);
    GL11.glViewport(0, 0, Display.getDisplayMode().getWidth(), Display.getDisplayMode().getHeight());

     GL11.glMatrixMode(GL11.GL_PROJECTION);
 GL11.glLoadIdentity();
 GLU.gluPerspective(30, Display.getDisplayMode().getWidth()/(float)Display.getDisplayMode().getHeight(), 1f, 300f);
 GL11.glMatrixMode(GL11.GL_MODELVIEW);
 GL11.glDepthMask(true);

    }

    public String getId() {
    return “MenuState”;
    }

    public UIOverlay getUI() {
    return ui;
    }

    public void render() {
    GL11.glClear(GL11.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT | GL11.GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT);
    GL11.glClearColor(0.224f, 0.340f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
    GL11.glMatrixMode(GL11.GL_PROJECTION);
    GL11.glPushMatrix();
    GL11.glLoadIdentity();
    GL11.glOrtho(0, Display.getDisplayMode().getWidth(), 0, Display.getDisplayMode().getHeight(), -1, 1);

     GL11.glMatrixMode(GL11.GL_MODELVIEW);
 GL11.glPushMatrix();
 GL11.glLoadIdentity();

 ui.render();
 font.drawString(8.0f, 4.0f, "Copyright(c) Johan Ljungberg 2010.", 1.0f, 1.0f);

    }

    public void update(int delta) {
    ui.update(delta);
    input.handle();
    }
    }[/code]

Damn women, wants confirmation on everything…

Read full topic

item.title: Super Mario Bros 3D
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Herp derp engine is coming along nicely, it now has lua-defined animations instead of hardcoded. I intend to make everythin modular this time around kthx. Fairly ugly lua scripts for it at the moment but that is because i cbf to add lua array support in my lib atm:

anim = { sheet = "mobs.png:16,16", states = { idle = "0,0,0", walk = "50,0,0:50,1,0", } }

Basically, sheet defines what sprites to use as well as what size to slice them in. the delimiters in states are as follows: “timing,row,column” and the “:” delimiter denotes multiple animation frames for a given state. The timing is basically for how many milliseconds a frame should be active before next one is used.

Engine can then parse this with simple calls like this:

SpriteAnimation walkAnim = SpriteAnimation.fromDef("player", "walk"); SpriteAnimation idleAnim = SpriteAnimation.fromDef("player", "idle");

EDIT: Durr update, wrote ui system for opengl, here is my sexy menu:

33kdn6f.png819×637

Read full topic
